pages.title: Welcome to Heimdal AI:OS
pages.content: You are inside Heimdal AI:OS â€” a developer-first OS wrapper that runs on top of your host OS and gives AI coders a consistent, auditable, and extensible CLI universe. Launch any CLI (e.g., Claude, Gemini) via Heimdal and it runs inside this universe with passthrough to your OS. Sessions expose helpful env vars (HEIMDAL_*) and generate lightweight context files for tools and automations.

pages.title: Heimdal Wiki (RAG Manpages)
pages.content: The Heimdal wiki is a Retrieval-Augmented (RAG) manpage system. Pages in wiki.json are indexed and can be searched at the terminal. Use 'heimdal wiki search
' to retrieve relevant pages and 'heimdal wiki show

' to read them. Over time, Heimdal can feed these pages into tool context so AI CLIs start preloaded with project and platform knowledge. Store this file in the repo root for project-scoped docs, or in ~/.heimdall/wiki.json for global docs.

pages.title: Quick Commands
pages.content:
Shell: 'heimdal shell' (prefix [hd] shows the universe).
Run any app: 'heimdal <app> [args...]' (alias for 'run <app>').
Add an app: 'heimdal app add claude --cmd claude'.
Search wiki: 'heimdal wiki search

pages.title: Contributing Wiki Pages
pages.content: wiki.json structure: {"pages":[{"title":string,"tags":[string],"content":string}...]}. Keep titles unique and concise, add descriptive tags, and write short factual content. For team/project docs, commit wiki.json to the repo. For personal/global notes, keep it under ~/.heimdall/wiki.json.
